results.name: Half of the gaps A067970 between odd nonprimes A014076.
comment: a(n) < 4 for n > 1; a(A196276(a(n)) = 1; a(A196277(a(n)) > 1. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 30 2011]
Lengths of runs of equal terms in A025549. That sequence begins with: 1,1,1,1,3,3,3,45,45,45,..., that is 4 ones, 3 threes, 3 forty-fives, ... - _Michel Marcus_, Dec 02 2014
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The smallest odd numbers which are not prime are 1, 9, 15, 21, 25, 27,... (sequence A014076).

The gaps between these are: 8, 6, 6, 4, 2,... (sequence A067970), which are of course all even by construction, so it makes sense to divide all of them by 2, which yields this sequence: 4, 3, 3, 2, 1, ...
xref: Cf. A142723 for the decimal value of the associated continued fraction.
results.author: _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 30 2011
ext: More terms from _Harvey P. Dale_, May 06 2012
